messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Fearlessness
messages.msgSnippet: Or  if you have nothing to lose.
messages.messageBody:
Or if you have nothing to lose.<<<<<<

***

That's where all of my 'tinkering' starts. I used to be terrified of trying to fix 'mechanical' things. Then it hit me -- it's already broken! How much worse could it get? I have fixed and rigged all kinds of broken toys and gadgets around the house in the last several years, simply because Gary was at work and we couldn't afford to replace the non-functioning item right away.

Syl


---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?
Friends. Fun. Try the all-new Yahoo! Messenger

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Fearlessness
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/8/2004 4:48:10 PM Eastern Daylight Time, pamsoroosh@mac.com writes: Also - I  have an acceptance that there are risks and costs to every
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/8/2004 4:48:10 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
pamsoroosh@... writes:

Also - I have an "acceptance" that there are risks and costs to every
decision - and if you don't just accept the risks and costs and take
action anyway, you're stuck. I fear being "stuck" far more than I fear
failure.<<<<<<<<



Right.


I'm happy to take the blame for a screw-up, but I like all the praise when I
do a good job, too! Generally, I'm NOT a "team" player! <G>


~Kelly

OH! My middle name! <bwg>


Ben's so tired of my saying that!


But....what do we have to lose? <g>


~Kelly
